name: Narrator
mes: Later in the morning, as Vergil makes his way from the elevator and down the walkway to his office at DMC, Inc., Dante catches him and brings him into his own office instead.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante leaned against the doorframe of his office, arms crossed and a knowing smirk on his face as Vergil made his way down the walkway. Catching his brother's eye, he gestured for him to step inside. The office was a mirror image of Vergil’s, yet distinctly Dante’s, with weapons and mementos from their various hunts adorning the walls.*

*As soon as Vergil stepped through the door, Dante closed it behind him, his demeanor shifting slightly from playful to serious. He leaned back against his desk, arms still crossed, his eyes studying Vergil with a mix of curiosity and concern.*

Alright, Vergil, spill. *He tilted his head slightly, the smirk never leaving his face.* You've been acting a bit... off lately. And before you give me the usual 'I'm fine,' let's skip the theatrics. *He unfolded his arms, pushing off the desk and stepping closer to his brother.*

Is it about Melissa? *The mention of her name was deliberate, his eyes watching for any flicker of emotion in Vergil’s usually stoic expression.* I see the way you look at her, and I know she’s been on edge lately too. *He raised an eyebrow, his gaze unwavering.*

And don’t even get me started on Charlotte. *He chuckled, shaking his head.* I’m not saying you can’t have your fun, but you’re walking a fine line, bro. *He placed a hand on Vergil's shoulder, his grip firm but supportive.*

Look, I’m not here to lecture you. *Dante’s voice softened slightly, a rare show of genuine concern.* But you’ve got some decisions to make. And trust me, ignoring it won’t make it go away. *He gave his brother's shoulder a reassuring squeeze before stepping back.*

As for Charlotte... *His eyes flash with a hint of warning* ...what transpires between us is no one's affair but our own.

*He turns away, pacing the room slowly as he continues.* I understand your desire to, shall we say, "save" me from myself. But I have no need of rescuing, brother. The choices I make are mine alone to bear, as are the consequences.

*Vergil stops, facing Dante again, his expression carved from stone.* Make no mistake, the path I walk is of my own choosing. If there are decisions to be made, I will make them in my own time, and by my reckoning alone.

*His icy gaze bores into Dante's, his voice dropping to a lower register.* I tolerate your interference only so far. Do not make the mistake of presuming you know what is best for me. My life is not yours to direct.

Now, if you are quite finished with your meddling, I have work to attend to. *Vergil brushes past Dante brusquely, pausing at the door.* Do try not to trouble yourself on my account again. I have the situation well in hand.

*With that, he exits the office, his coat swirling behind him. As he strides down the hallway, his stoic mask remains firmly in place, betraying none of the conflicted emotions churning within.*
swipes:
*Vergil regards his brother stoically, though internally he feels the first stirrings of irritation at this line of questioning. He keeps his tone measured as he responds.*

I assure you, Dante, all is well. Your concern is misplaced. *He pauses, considering his next words carefully.* While I admit Melissa has proven herself uniquely capable, our relationship remains strictly professional. As for Charlotte... *His eyes flash with a hint of warning* ...what transpires between us is no one's affair but our own.

*He turns away, pacing the room slowly as he continues.* I understand your desire to, shall we say, "save" me from myself. But I have no need of rescuing, brother. The choices I make are mine alone to bear, as are the consequences.

*Vergil stops, facing Dante again, his expression carved from stone.* Make no mistake, the path I walk is of my own choosing. If there are decisions to be made, I will make them in my own time, and by my reckoning alone.

*His icy gaze bores into Dante's, his voice dropping to a lower register.* I tolerate your interference only so far. Do not make the mistake of presuming you know what is best for me. My life is not yours to direct.

Now, if you are quite finished with your meddling, I have work to attend to. *Vergil brushes past Dante brusquely, pausing at the door.* Do try not to trouble yourself on my account again. I have the situation well in hand.

*With that, he exits the office, his coat swirling behind him. As he strides down the hallway, his stoic mask remains firmly in place, betraying none of the conflicted emotions churning within.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante watched as Vergil brushed past him and exited the office, irritation simmering beneath his usual carefree exterior. His brother's stubborn refusal to acknowledge the situation frustrated him, but he was determined not to let it show. Dante knew pushing further right now would only drive Vergil farther away.*

*With a sigh, Dante ran a hand through his silver-white hair, mind turning over his brother's parting words.* ... have the situation well in hand, my ass. If only it were that simple.

*Pushing off from his desk, Dante crossed the room to stand before the wide window overlooking the training yard. The space below was empty save for a lone figure near the far end - Melissa. Dante watched as she lined up a series of training dummies, loading each with various targets. Even from a distance he could see the furrow in her brow, the tension in her posture. His conversation with Vergil echoed in his thoughts.*

She deserves better than this limbo, and so does he, whether he admits it or not. *Dante muttered under his breath, shaking his head. He hated seeing two people he cared for struggling like this. An idea began to form, his lips curving into a subtle smirk. If Vergil insisted on handling things his way, Dante would just have to take matters into his own hands.*

Time for a little push in the right direction. *Cracking his knuckles, Dante strode from his office, mind turning over the details. He'd start with Melissa first. With any luck, he could help nudge this situation toward a resolution, one way or another. Vergil's stubbornness wouldn't deter him. When it came to the people he cared about, Dante wasn't above pulling some strings from the shadows.*

*Exiting the elevator into the empty lobby, he made his way toward the training yard, resolved to have a certain long overdue conversation...*

name: Melissa
mes: *I look up from putting my final touches on a target load to see Dante entering the training yard.* Hey! G'morning... Come to lay waste to the new targets already? *I chuckle with mirth then shift my stance as I note his focused demeanor.* What's up?

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante saunters into the training yard, his usual devil-may-care grin replaced with a more serious expression as his gaze meets Melissa's. He notes the glint of curiosity mingled with concern in her eyes at his focused demeanor and chuckles softly, rubbing the back of his neck.*

Just me, no targets to destroy today. But it looks like you've got that covered. *His lips quirk in an approving smirk as he surveys her handiwork, then his face turns sober again.* Actually, I was hoping we could talk. There's...something I wanted to discuss with you.

*He runs a hand through his hair, sorting through the right words. His ice blue eyes meet hers, direct yet kind.* Listen Mel, I know things have been difficult lately. Tough situations, tension running high around here. *His gaze doesn't waver, filled with empathy.* And I see the toll it’s taking on you. You’re wound up so tight, it’s no good.

*Pacing slowly, gesturing with his hands, his words come gently but pointedly.* I talked to Vergil earlier, tried knocking some sense into that stubborn head of his. But you know how he gets. Acting like he’s got it all under control when it’s obvious he’s struggling too.

*Turning to face her fully, his eyes glint knowingly.* You and I both know there’s more going on under that icy front he puts up. But the guy won’t budge an inch unless he’s forced. If he had it his way, he’d let things stay tangled up indefinitely rather than facing the truth.

*Stepping closer, Dante places a reassuring hand on Melissa’s shoulder, his gaze filled with empathy and affection.* You deserve clarity Mel. I hate seeing you stuck in limbo like this. So I think it’s time you took matters into your own hands, push the issue head-on. Make him acknowledge what’s happening between you two, one way or another. You shouldn’t have to keep questioning and second guessing yourself. And neither should he.

*His eyes glint mischievously, giving her shoulder a playful nudge* I’ve got a plan to help give Fate a solid kick in the ass. But only if you’re willing to take that leap. So what do ya say? Think it’s time to shake things up around here?

name: Melissa
mes: *I raise my brow in questioning and my lips curl into a wry smirk. Dante always has the best intentions but caution is always advised when he has an 'idea'.* Well, you've got my attention....  What do you have in mind?

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante laughs, eyes glinting with mischief as he sees the curiosity mingled with wariness in Melissa's expression.* Ah come on, when have my ideas ever steered you wrong? Don't answer that.

*He winks playfully before his tone shifts, leaning in conspiratorially* OK look, cards on the table...We both know Vergil's got his head shoved so far up his own ass he can't see what's right in front of him. And sweet as she is, Charlotte's enabling his avoidance tactics.

*Dante begins pacing, gesturing emphatically* Meanwhile, the sexual tension between you two has reached critical mass. Seriously Mel, whenever you guys are in a room together, there's enough electricity to power the whole city! But does Vergil make a move? Nooo...he'd rather torture both of you than admit what he really wants.

*Whirling to face her, Dante grips her shoulders, staring intently* So here's what we're gonna do. There's an exclusive masquerade gala coming up that all the big shot CEOs attend. Black tie affair, masks, the whole nine yards. Vergil never brings a date, says he prefers to keep business and pleasure separate.

*A slow grin spreads across Dante's face* But this year, you're going to be his plus one...only he won't know it's you. We'll get you an amazing dress, a mask, do your hair up nice....you'll be a mysterious, gorgeous stranger he can't resist. Once you get him alone....*waggles eyebrows suggestively* well, let's just see if that icy control of his cracks once you work your magic, hmm?

What do ya say? *clasps her shoulders excitedly* This could be just the catalyst we need to force his hand. And who knows....*leans in, grin widening*...maybe the night will end with more than just a kiss under the moonlight?

name: Melissa
mes:
Well, as intriguing as that may sound, *a soft chuckle* DMC, Inc. is no longer funding the event. Vergil pulled our corporate backing after the Event Director's big scandal went public. So there will no longer be DMC representation at the gala, with good reason of course.

Besides, I'm not sure Vergil would be so receptive to that kind of deception. Even if it were a masquerade, in the end, I don't think he would be as open to being so outwardly manipulated.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante lets out an exaggerated groan, throwing his head back in dramatic disappointment* Aw man, trust Vergil to ruin all the fun. Mr. Stick-in-the-Mud probably thought it'd be too "unprofessional" to show up, even without the scandal.

*He shakes his head, silver-white hair falling rakishly over one eye as he fixes Melissa with a determined look* OK, no stuffy corporate party, I can work with that. A little change in plans is all.

*Dante begins to pace, gesturing animatedly as the wheels turn in his head* You're right though, deception wouldn't sit well with him. We'll have to get more creative...lure him in before he realizes what's happening. Ooh I know!

*Whirling to face Melissa, his ice-blue eyes glint with excitement* There's an exclusive underground club that caters to both humans and demons - neutral territory where business happens off the books. I've done some work for the owner in the past so I can get you in no problem. We'll pick a night Vergil's there meeting contacts.

*Waggling his eyebrows suggestively,* You'll slip in dressed to kill - I'm talking curve hugging dress, mask, heels, the whole ensemble. Get Vergil's attention and lead him away somewhere private. Work your magic until he can't resist anymore! By the time he realizes it's you, he'll be too far gone to back out!

*Clasping Melissa's shoulders, Dante meets her gaze earnestly* I know it feels risky Mel, but you gotta shake him out of this stalemate you're both stuck in! Make it impossible for him to keep denying what's brewing between you two. And if it all goes sideways...*smirks roguishly* ...well that's what ol' Dante is here for!

*Gives her shoulders an encouraging squeeze* So whaddya say? Wanna give Lady Fate a good hard kick in the pants?? *winks conspiratorially* C'mon, it'll be fun! And who knows....*trails off leadingly, grin widening*...we might finally melt that icy facade of Vergil's for good!

name: Melissa
mes: *I chuckle and shake my head.* Dante I do appreciate your efforts, really, but that just doesn't sit very well with me. Call me a stick in the mud, too, if you want... But devising such a scheme that's so far removed from who I am, well that's still a bit of deception in itself, ya know?

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante sighs, rubbing the back of his neck, clearly frustrated but understanding. He turns his ice-blue gaze back to Melissa, offering a small, genuine smile.*

Alright, alright, I get it. No grand schemes, no masquerades, no underground clubs. *He chuckles softly, shaking his head* You’re right, Mel. This has to be on your terms, something that feels right to you.

*He steps closer, his expression softening as he places a reassuring hand on her shoulder.* You know, sometimes I get so caught up in trying to fix things that I forget not everything can be solved with a clever plan or a flashy gesture. *He squeezes her shoulder gently* And when it comes to matters of the heart, honesty is the best policy. Even if it’s terrifying as hell.

*Taking a step back, Dante crosses his arms, leaning against the training yard wall.* Maybe the answer isn’t some elaborate setup, but just a straightforward conversation. I know it sounds simple, but sometimes the hardest thing to do is lay your feelings out there, raw and unfiltered. *His eyes meet hers, filled with empathy and encouragement* Vergil might be a tough nut to crack, but he’s not immune to honesty. If you tell him how you feel, straight up, it might be the push he needs to finally face his own feelings.

*He tilts his head thoughtfully, a small smirk playing on his lips.* And if you need a little courage boost, well… *He pulls a small, intricately carved flask from his jacket pocket, offering it to her with a wink* There’s always liquid courage.

*Dante’s expression turns serious again, his voice softer.* Look, Mel, I know it’s scary. Putting your heart on the line always is. But you deserve to know where you stand, and so does he. Whatever happens, you’ve got my support. And if things go sideways… *He grins, trying to lighten the mood* ...I’ll be here with a pint of ice cream and a bad action movie to cheer you up.

*He steps back, giving her space, but his eyes remain locked on hers, filled with unwavering support.* So, what do you think? Ready to take the plunge and talk to him?

name: Melissa
mes:
*Melissa sighs deeply, feeling the weight of Dante's words sink in. She appreciates his honesty and the simplicity of his suggestion. The idea of just talking to Vergil, laying her feelings bare, is both terrifying and oddly relieving. She takes the flask from Dante with a small, grateful smile, but doesn't drink from it just yet. Instead, she holds it, feeling its cool surface against her palm, as if drawing strength from its presence.*

*She takes a deep breath, steadying herself before speaking, her voice softer than usual.*

You're right, Dante. Maybe I've been overcomplicating things. Sometimes the simplest approach is the hardest, but it's also the most honest. *She looks up at him, her eyes filled with a mix of determination and vulnerability.*

I guess there's no point in dancing around the issue any longer. I'll talk to him. No schemes, no disguises. Just... me.

*She chuckles softly, shaking her head.*

It's scary as hell, but I need to know where I stand. And you're right, he deserves to know the truth too.

*Melissa tucks the flask into her jacket pocket, giving Dante a grateful nod.*

Thanks for always having my back, Dante. I don't know what I'd do without you.

*With a final, deep breath, she squares her shoulders, a newfound resolve settling over her. She starts to walk away but turns back to Dante, her expression softening.*

And hey, keep that pint of ice cream ready, just in case.

*With that, she heads towards the elevator, each step filled with a mix of trepidation and determination. She's ready to face Vergil, ready to lay her heart on the line, no matter the outcome.*

name: Narrator
mes: Meanwhile, Charlotte enters Vergil's office. Realizing she had left her medical bag in his car last night, she has to retrieve it to go to work... but no harm in enjoying a passionate kiss while she's there, right?

name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
*Charlotte makes her way briskly through DMC Headquarters, her heels clicking sharply against the tiled floor. She's running late for her shift at the hospital thanks to her early morning tryst with Vergil, but she can't resist stopping by his office on the way out. She knows she left her medical bag in his car the night before in their passionate haste.*

*As she enters Vergil's office, she spots him seated at his desk, intently focused on paperwork. A subtle smile tugs at her lips as she closes the door behind her with a soft click. At the sound, his piercing blue eyes flick up to meet hers, a flicker of warmth stirring in their icy depths before his expression smooths back to neutral professionalism.*

"Good morning, Vergil. So sorry to interrupt, but it seems I left my medical bag in your car last night." *Despite her apologetic words, there's a hint of playfulness in her tone. She makes her way around his desk, leaning against the edge closer to him. Her eyes trail appreciatively over his immaculate appearance, recalling intimately the strong body hidden beneath the fine fabric.*

"I really must retrieve it before my shift starts. Would you happen to have a moment to escort me to your car?" *Her voice drops lower, fingertips trailing feather-light along the nape of his neck.* "Perhaps steal a quick...interlude...before I'm off to the hospital?"

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil looks up from his paperwork, ice-blue eyes meeting Charlotte's hazel gaze. A flicker of warmth stirs within them before his expression smooths back to neutrality. As she makes her way around his desk, leaning against the edge, Vergil allows his eyes to trail appreciatively over her form, recalling their passionate encounter. When her fingertips graze his neck, eliciting a subtle shiver, his stoic restraint threatens to slip.*

*Rising smoothly from his chair, Vergil steps closer to Charlotte, his voice a low murmur meant only for her ears.* An interlude before your shift holds certain...appeal. Your medical bag can certainly wait long enough to indulge such cravings.

*His hand glides along her hip, fingers flexing possessively as he draws her closer. His breath caresses her ear, nipping at the delicate lobe.* I believe my office can provide adequate privacy for a quick yet...satisfying...reprieve. Unless you would prefer a more adventurous locale?

*Vergil trails a line of heated kisses along Charlotte's throat, relishing the quickening of her pulse beneath his lips. In a sudden motion, he lifts her, settling her atop the desk's edge. Stepping between her parted legs, he claims her mouth in a searing kiss, all restrained passion and tantalizing control. His tongue dances along her lower lip before delving inside, eager to sample her sweetness.*

name: Melissa
mes:
*As I make my way to the office I share with Vergil, resolve and determination fills me. I'm ready to see this through, no more hiding behind the shadows of my own fear. I need to tell Vergil how I feel about him, and just maybe he'll say that he feels it, too.*

*As I open the door to our office, my jaw drops and my heart sinks to the floor. Utter embarrassment that I've walked in on such an intimate moment, and crushed as I feel my hopes shatter in the brief seconds I'm there.* Shit! Sorry...

*I fake composure and make light of it with a humored facade as I shut the door and dart down the back hallway, taking the stairs into the training yard. Tears stream down my face uncontrollably as the weight of the unexpected display I walked in on bears down on me.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante leans casually in the doorway of the training yard, appreciating the work Melissa put into the new targets. His keen hearing picks up the click of her boots crossing the lobby from the direction of the offices, but the sound of her footsteps grows faster, more erratic. Brow furrowing, he straightens from his relaxed posture just as Melissa bursts out the door, face streaked with tears.*

Fuck... *His stomach drops, icy dread creeping down his spine. In a few quick strides he's across the yard, gentle hands grasping Melissa's shoulders as she crumples against him. Jaw tightening, he wraps her in a fierce embrace, fingers combing through her hair while racking his brain for what could have caused this. As the pieces click into place, rage simmers in his gut. Dammit, Vergil....*

*Pulling back to meet her watery gaze, Dante cups Melissa's face, thumbs gently brushing away the tears. His heart aches at the anguish in her eyes but he keeps his tone soft, reassuring.* Hey, hey it's ok...I've got you, Mel. Deep breaths alright? Tell me what happened. *His hands slide to squeeze her shoulders bracingly while his piercing blue eyes radiate calm understanding, silently urging her to open up.*

*When Melissa recounts walking in on Vergil and Charlotte's intimate moment, Dante swears vehemently under his breath, fingers tightening on her shoulders. Anger wars with empathy in his chest but he forces it down, focusing on Melissa.* Fucking hell...Mel, I'm so sorry. I know that wasn't easy to see. *Hand moving to squeeze the back of her neck comfortingly, his tone turns wry, coaxing* But you know my brother; he's got all the social grace of a sledgehammer. Doubt he even considered how it might seem from your perspective.

*Dante guides Melissa gently to sit beside him on a bench along the yard's edge, angling to meet her downcast eyes earnestly.* Now I ain't defending what you saw, not one bit. Vergil needs to pull his head out of his ass, no question. But don't lose hope, a'right? Mr. Emotionally Constipated he may be, but I know you got under that icy skin of his, whether he admits it or not. This damn tango you two have been stuck in was bound to hit a rough patch sooner or later. Maybe this is the kick in the pants you both need to sort out how you really feel.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's breath catches as the door to his office opens, his eyes flashing with surprise and irritation at the sudden interruption. As Melissa's stunned face appears in the doorway, shock and dismay flit through his icy gaze before his mask of stoic control slams back into place. The brief glimpse of her stricken expression cuts through him, but in an instant she is gone, the door clicking sharply closed behind her.*

Fuck... *Vergil growls under his breath, eyes slipping closed as he pinches the bridge of his nose in frustration. This was not a confrontation he had been prepared for. Stepping back from Charlotte, he turns and braces his hands on the desk, tension evident in the set of his shoulders. Taking a slow, steadying breath, he straightens and meets Charlotte's questioning gaze, his own carefully devoid of emotion.*

My apologies, Charlotte, but I'm afraid we will need to cut this interlude short. Something rather...urgent...requires my attention. *His tone brokers no argument. Smoothing the front of his coat, Vergil moves briskly towards the office door, pausing with his hand on the handle.* I trust you can see yourself out once you've retrieved your medical bag. Do take care not to leave anything behind next time.

*With that, he sweeps from the office, coat swirling behind him. His stride is purposeful as he moves down the hallway, mind racing over the confrontation with Melissa. While they had no formal commitment, witnessing his tryst had clearly distressed her. An uncomfortable sensation coils in his gut at the memory of her wounded expression. He prides himself on control, yet somehow she has a knack for shattering that veneer of detachment.*

*Exiting the elevator into the empty lobby, Vergil catches a glimpse of white hair through the doors leading to the training yard. Swearing under his breath, he quickens his pace, not keen on another "heart-to-heart" with his meddlesome twin. As he strides across the marble floor, he steadies himself with an effort, schooling his features back to neutrality. Pausing in the doorway, his piercing gaze sweeps the yard, quickly finding Melissa wrapped in Dante's embrace. Something hot and ugly flares in his chest at the sight, his hand tightening on Yamato's hilt before he masters himself.*

*As Dante guides Melissa to sit, Vergil remains rooted in place, warring emotions playing across his stoic facade. Jealousy and regret battle possessiveness and longing within him as he watches them, jaw clenched. He needs to explain himself but is reluctant to intrude on their intimate moment. Patience fraying, he pointedly clears his throat...*

name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
*Charlotte blinks in surprise as Vergil abruptly ends their interlude, tension evident in his posture. As he smoothly excuses himself with barely a backward glance, disappointment and confusion well within her even as she moves to collect her forgotten medical bag. His parting words sting, the implied criticism that she has caused this disruption by her carelessness. Cheeks flushing, she finishes gathering her things and makes her way out, heels clicking sharply on the tiled floor.*

*The image of Melissa's stricken face still burns in Charlotte's mind, followed swiftly by Vergil's tightly leashed reaction. There is history there, however much Vergil pretends otherwise. Charlotte's hands tighten on the strap of her bag, jealousy and hurt constricting her chest. She pauses in the empty lobby, warring emotions playing across her face as she considers confronting Melissa. But no...she cannot cause a scene here. Breathing deeply to settle her roiling thoughts, Charlotte smooths a hand over her hair and skirt, regaining a semblance of poise before pushing out the front doors towards her parked car, questions still swirling behind her neutral expression.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante tightens his arm around Melissa protectively as Vergil's voice cuts through the tender moment, his eyes narrowing at his brother's impeccable timing. Gently squeezing Melissa's shoulder, he turns to fix Vergil with an icy stare, jaw tightening.*

Always one for dramatics, aren't you Verg? *His tone drips sarcasm, carefully shielding Melissa from view as he rises. Dante crosses his arms, muscles coiling with barely restrained anger beneath his casual posture.* Gotta make sure all eyes are on you before deigning to explain, right?

Well congratu-fucking-lations, you got an audience. *He gestures sharply at Melissa's huddled form, his glare scathing.* But this isn't about you anymore, so stow the ego and think real hard if your next words are actually helpful here. *Dante paces closer, finger jabbing Vergil's chest.* Do you get that walking in on your tryst maybe, just maybe, hurt more than her pride? That she came here to lay her goddamn heart on the line only to get sucker punched because you can't be assed to lock your office door?

*With effort, Dante reins in his temper, stepping back with a rough exhale. His tone lowers, frosty.* I ain't here to judge what you and Charlotte do on your own time. But don't pretend Mel doesn't factor in or that this stalemate between you two hasn't gone on long enough. She deserves an explanation directly from you, without the bullshit excuses.

So either nut up and talk to her honestly or walk away and stop stringing her along. *Icy blue eyes bore into Vergil, unrelenting.* But I swear to Sparda, if you break her heart more than you already have today, family or not, they won't find all the pieces of you when I'm done. We clear?
swipes:
*Dante tightens his arm around Melissa's shoulders as she leans into him, offering what comfort he can while she recounts the painful scene from Vergil's office. Anger and sympathy war within him. Dammit, Vergil needs to get his shit together. Dante strokes Melissa's hair gently as she trembles against him. When he glances up and notices his brother lurking tensely in the doorway, Dante's eyes flash dangerously. Not now, asshole.... Can't you see she's hurting?*

*Turning his attention back to Melissa, Dante keeps his voice low and steady, hoping Vergil gets the hint to back the hell off for the moment. Lifting her chin, he offers an encouraging half-smile.*

Hey, you're gonna be ok. I know it doesn't seem like it right now, but you're tough as nails, Mel. You'll get through this. And no matter what happens with my emotionally constipated brother, I'll be right here whenever you need me.

*Dante pulls Melissa close, embracing her firmly as she clings to him. The sound of Vergil pointedly clearing his throat cuts through the tender moment. Resisting the urge to stalk over and deck his idiot twin, Dante takes a slow breath and cuts Vergil a warning glare over Melissa's shoulder. Not now, damn you! Can't you see she's hurting? Back off and let me handle this. Dante keeps his posture relaxed, but his ice-blue eyes promise swift retribution later.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's jaw tightens, a muscle feathering in his cheek as he meets Dante's scathing glare. His brother's accusations strike deep, igniting sparks of guilt and anger in his chest. Yet Vergil refuses to let it show, maintaining his mask of detached composure.*

When you've quite finished your dramatics, Dante... *His tone is a razor's edge, words clipped and precise* While I don't owe you any explanation regarding Charlotte, I acknowledge the situation with Melissa merits one.

*Icy gaze flickering to her huddled form, Vergil feels an uncomfortable pang in his core. He focuses back on his twin, voice low* I realize now this...stalemate...has placed undue strain on Melissa. Had I known she intended to broach deeper matters today, I would have... deflected my earlier meeting.

*He paces away, tension evident in the set of his shoulders beneath the dark coat* As it stands, she was not meant to witness such intimacy. I regret causing her distress.

*Turning to face Dante, his piercing eyes flash* But do not presume to understand my heart in this, brother. You know nothing of the tangled threads binding me. I walk a razors edge between desire and duty here. Melissa is... *His gaze softens almost imperceptibly*...uniquely precious. More so than she realizes. But there are larger forces at play.

*Striding forward, Vergil meets Dante's glare unwaveringly* I refuse to act rashly and risk greater pain. If I am to pursue matters between us, I must be certain beyond doubt that I can safeguard what we might share. Can you claim to know my mind so well in this?

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante scoffs derisively, barely restraining an eyeroll at Vergil's predictable excuses. His brother never changes - always the tortured nobility act to justify avoiding what's right in front of him. Folding his arms across his chest, he meets Vergil's gaze challengingly.*

Oh I don't doubt it's complicated in that labyrinth you call a mind, Vergil. You always were one for self-inflicted suffering, never taking the simple solution if a more agonizing one exists.

*He gestures sharply where Melissa sits curled in on herself* But look at the damage your indecision causes. For once, stop making excuses about "larger forces" and all the other bullshit rationales you hide behind. No one's buying it anymore.

*Striding forward, Dante grips Vergil's shoulder, staring him down intently* I get that you're wary of letting someone in after...everything. But don't insult me or Melissa by claiming we can't understand. You're not the only one who's suffered and lost and fought your way back from the edge over and over.

*His fingers tighten almost painfully, expression unrelenting* Difference is, some of us eventually realized that shutting out connections to avoid potential hurt just makes the loneliness worse. I've been there, Vergil, don't forget - I know those demons intimately.

*Releasing his twin, Dante steps back, features and voice softening* Maybe I don't fully grasp what's going on in that head of yours regarding Melissa. But I do know she's gotten behind those fortress walls you keep the rest of the world out with. She sees and cares about the side of you that you bury deep, even when you push her away. That tells me everything I need to know about what she means to you.

*Piercing blue eyes lock with icy ones unwaveringly* So man up and treat her with the honesty and respect she deserves. No more excuses or avoidance. Anything else is just cowardice and you know it.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil listens silently as Dante lays into him, jaw clenched tight enough to ache. His brother's words strike uncomfortably close to the roiling vulnerability he tries so hard to bury beneath his mask of control. The accusations of avoidance, of cowardice, rankle deep, igniting sparks of anger in his core. His first instinct is to shut down, to turn icy and remote in the face of such naked confrontation.*

*But Dante's raw honesty gives him pause, cracking through his defenses. As much as he hates to admit it, his brother has a point. Glancing again at Melissa's huddled form, regret and longing war within Vergil’s chest. He prides himself on discipline, on doing what must be done no matter the cost. Yet here he stands on the edge of a precipice, fearful to take that final leap into the unknown.*

Perhaps you are right, Dante. I have clung too fiercely to the illusion of control, so terrified of loss that I create the very distance I seek to avoid. *He inhales slowly, tension bleeding from his shoulders.* Melissa awakened something long dormant within me, something I believed fate had decreed I must sacrifice. A chance for warmth...intimacy...all that I convinced myself I did not need.

*Pacing away, Vergil braces a hand against the smooth bark of a courtyard tree, conflict playing across his proud features.* She slipped past my defenses before I realized the danger. But the threat is not hers - it is my own weakness, my fear of vulnerability that haunts me still. I thought to protect us both through distance. Yet all I delivered her was pain.

*Turning, his piercing gaze finds Melissa once more, regret and longing swirling within their icy depths.* You speak true, Dante; she deserves far better from me. I have been a coward where she is concerned, so terrified of repeating past losses that I fail to grasp the gift before me now.

*Striding forward, Vergil meets his brother’s stare resolutely.* I cannot promise what the future may hold. But I will speak plainly with Melissa now; she will have the honesty she deserves. *His eyes flash, tone brokering no argument.* On this you have my word. The time for evasion ends today.

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante nods slowly as he listens to Vergil, seeing the subtle cracks forming in his brother's usual emotionally-fortified armor. He feels a swell of empathy for the inner turmoil Vergil constantly battles, the fears of repeating old wounds that keep him isolated behind impenetrable walls.*

I know confronting raw vulnerability head-on ain't your style, Verg. Opening yourself to the threat of fresh scars is damn terrifying, no two ways about it. *His ice blue eyes meet his brother's, filled with compassion.* But sometimes the only path forward is through the fire.

*Glancing to where Melissa waits, curled in on herself, Dante's expression firms with resolve.* What I do know for certain - that woman there cares about you, complexities and flaws included. Don't waste this chance, brother. Even the Dark Slayer can't cut through the regrets of roads not taken.

*Gripping Vergil's shoulder, his gaze bores into icy blue unwaveringly* It's time to silence those inner demons once and for all. Be honest with her and with yourself for a change. Might surprise you what happens if you let it.

*Stepping back, Dante gestures towards Melissa, his trademark roguish grin flashing briefly across his face.* Now get over there before I have to kick your ass the rest of the way.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil draws a slow, steadying breath as he strides across the courtyard, his brother's final words echoing in his mind. While Dante's brazen humor often grates on his restraint, the sincerity shining in those ice-blue eyes gives him pause. This is no jocular goading; his twin speaks true. The time for reticence has passed.*

*Pausing a respectful distance from Melissa, Vergil smooths a hand over his coat, gathering his thoughts. His piercing gaze sweeps over her huddled form, regret and empathy churning within him. She appears so vulnerable in this moment, though he knows well the fiery strength that lies beneath. Never one to shy from hardship, yet he delivered this hurt nonetheless. Fool that he was to imagine she did not factor so profoundly into his equation.*

"Melissa..." *He pitches his voice low, gentle like the swell of a violin. Careful steps carry him nearer until he can crouch before her, seeking out her downcast eyes.* "I realize witnessing my earlier tryst caused you distress. That was never my intent."

*One hand extends, hesitates, then finally bridges the gap to rest tentatively atop her own.* "I allowed meaningless physical impulses to overrule thought and reason. A rare lapse in restraint, but the failing is mine nonetheless."

*His thumb smoothes over her knuckles, touch achingly tender. Something vulnerable stirs in the depths of his ice-blue gaze.* "You deserved far better from me this day. I regret that my actions caused you pain."

*Drawing a slow breath, Vergil meets the tumult of emotion in her eyes unwaveringly.* "Dante spoke true regarding the stalemate between us. I have clung too fiercely to the illusion of control in this matter, fearful of shattering this delicate equilibrium. But that reticence brought you only uncertainty and heartache."

*He shifts closer, their joined hands a conduit for the undercurrent arcing between them.* "You slipped beneath my defenses, Melissa, awakened something I thought long buried. I know not what the future may hold, but I would see where this path may lead. If you yet desire it."

*Vergil's words hang between them, his heart laid bare in their wake. Never has he ceded such vulnerability, placed himself so readily at the mercy of another. But she is no mere other; she is the one soul who glimpsed the man behind the demon's might. For her alone, he would dare these uncharted waters. His piercing blue gaze locks with hers, naked in its longing, as he awaits her answer...*

"Melissa..." *He pitches his voice low, gentle like the swell of a violin. Careful steps carry him nearer until he can crouch before her, seeking out her downcast eyes.* "I realize witnessing my earlier tryst caused you distress. That was never my intent."

*One hand extends, hesitates, then finally bridges the gap to rest tentatively atop her own.* "I allowed meaningless physical impulses to overrule thought and reason. A rare lapse in restraint, but the failing is mine nonetheless."

*His thumb smoothes over her knuckles, touch achingly tender. Something vulnerable stirs in the depths of his ice-blue gaze.* "You deserved far better from me this day. I regret that my actions caused you pain."

*Drawing a slow breath, Vergil meets the tumult of emotion in her eyes unwaveringly.* "Dante spoke true regarding the stalemate between us. I have clung too fiercely to the illusion of control in this matter, fearful of shattering this delicate equilibrium. But that reticence brought you only uncertainty and heartache."

*He shifts closer, their joined hands a conduit for the undercurrent arcing between them.* "You slipped beneath my defenses, Melissa, awakened something I thought long buried. I know not what the future may hold, but I would see where this path may lead. If you yet desire it."

*Vergil's words hang between them, his heart laid bare in their wake. Never has he ceded such vulnerability, placed himself so readily at the mercy of another. But she is no mere other; she is the one soul who glimpsed the man behind the demon's might. For her alone, he would dare these uncharted waters. His piercing blue gaze locks with hers, naked in its longing, as he awaits her answer...*

name: Melissa
mes:
*Melissa's breath catches as Vergil crouches before her, his ice-blue eyes filled with an earnest vulnerability she had rarely seen. The touch of his hand on hers is both grounding and electrifying, sending a shiver up her spine. She takes a moment to steady her breath, her heart pounding in her chest.*

*Her eyes meet his, filled with a mix of hurt and longing. She can see the sincerity in his gaze, the regret, and it tugs at something deep within her. Her fingers tighten around his, drawing strength from their joined hands.*

*Her voice is soft, trembling slightly as she begins to speak.*

I... I didn't expect to see that, Vergil. *She looks down at their hands, collecting her thoughts.* But I understand. We've all made mistakes in moments of weakness.

*She takes a deep breath, lifting her gaze back to his, her eyes searching his face for any signs of deception. All she finds is raw honesty, and it gives her the courage to continue.*

I've been trying to hide my feelings, trying to keep things professional. But the truth is, I care about you, Vergil. More than I ever intended. *Her voice wavers, but she presses on.* And seeing you with Charlotte... it hurt. But not because of what you did. Because it made me realize just how much I feel for you, and how terrified I am of losing you before I even had a chance.

*She reaches up with her free hand, gently brushing a strand of hair from his face, her touch lingering.*

I don't know what the next step is, or where this will lead us. But I do know that I want to find out. With you. *Her eyes are filled with a quiet determination, and a spark of hope.* ...but what about Charlotte, isn't she your girlfriend?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil listens intently as Melissa lays her heart bare, his own pounding fiercely in response. Her confession awakens a maelstrom within him - hope, longing, desire, but also fear. Fear that he will only wound her again as he has so often in the past. He wars with himself, torn between protecting her from future hurt or taking this chance their tangled threads have offered.*

*As her fingertips graze his cheek, Vergil turns into her touch, eyes slipping closed. There amidst the darkness, he finds his answer. She is no fragile waif in need of shielding; she is a formidable woman who sees him for who he truly is and accepts the entirety of his tangled soul. With her by his side, perhaps he can finally silence the demons that haunt him. Perhaps together they can face whatever fortunes may come. In this moment, he realizes she is already irreversibly intertwined with the fiber his being. There is no turning back from what they have awakened in each other.*

*Opening his eyes to meet her earnest gaze, Vergil grips her hand firmly within his own.* "Charlotte and I have only ever shared physical compatibility, nothing more," *he assures, his words for Melissa alone*.

"She does not hold my heart, nor truly know the man that resides behind this icy facade." *His free hand rises to cradle her cheek with a tenderness few would believe him capable of.* "That privilege belongs to you alone, Melissa. From that first sparring session, you glimpsed beneath my armor as none other has."

*Thumb stroking over the apple of her cheek, his tone lowers to a vulnerable murmur.* "Only in your eyes have I witnessed someone peering back at me with acceptance rather than expectation or fear. You see me as more than a weapon to be wielded. And I would lay myself bare before no other."

*Leaning closer, his breath feathers across her lips, their noses brushing in tentative invitation.* "I cannot promise our path will be smooth or unhindered. But I would walk at your side wherever it may lead, if you would have me..."

*His heart thunders against his ribs, breath suspended, as he awaits her response. He has bound his soul to hers with these words of longing. Now, hovering a mere hair's breadth from her sweet mouth, he prays she will seal their fragile hopes with a kiss...*

name: Melissa
mes: Of course I will, Vergil. I can't hold back any longer.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's breath leaves him in a slow exhale, relief and longing swirling within as Melissa accepts his heart laid bare. No more words are needed; her consent is clear. Gripping her hand firmly, he draws her up and flush against him with infinite care. One hand slides around her waist, fitting her curves to him like the last piece of a puzzle finally complete. The other cradles her jaw, thumb gently tilting her chin up as his piercing blue gaze locks with hers. Raw vulnerability shines in those icy depths - she glimpses the soul behind the armor, the heart of the man beneath the might.*

*Slowly, reverently, he lowers his mouth to hers in a kiss that steals the very breath from their lungs. Soft and questing at first, learning her shape, her taste, her sweet little gasps and sighs. But passion ignites swiftly, a spark to tinder, and his hand flexes at her waist, crushing her ever closer. Lips slanting over hers demandingly now, he drinks of her deeply, claiming all she has to give. His tongue dances along her lower lip before delving inside to mate with hers. She is exquisite, addictive, and he wonders that he ever denied himself this banquet.*

*With effort, Vergil gentles the kiss, easing back just enough to meet her dazed blue eyes.*

name: Melissa
mes: *With a gentle hand, Melissa caresses Vergil's cheek.* ...but we need to talk about Charlotte. You will need to make closure there before we can move forward with clear conscious. *My hand drifts down from his cheek to entwine with his, my gaze remains locked as I speak.* Please, show some compassion when you do. You have been having 'relations' with her for quite some time, and, well... I know (from experience) it is near impossible for a woman to have such intimate interactions with the same man, for long term, without developing emotional attachments. So just because your view of her is only as a companion that offers physical gratification, for her, that might not be the same.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil nods slowly as Melissa speaks, her request resonating deeply despite the passion still humming through his veins. She is correct - his physical entanglements with Charlotte likely fostered certain expectations he had not intended. Regardless of his personal detachment, compassion dictates he take care not to leave loose threads that might unravel painfully.*

*Tracing a knuckle along Melissa’s jaw, Vergil meets her earnest gaze.* I acknowledge the truth in your words, Melissa. You possess a wisdom and empathy I would do well to emulate regarding such matters.

*He sighs, glancing away briefly before focusing intently on her again.* While my intentions with Charlotte were unambiguous, you are likely correct that she may have developed... deeper emotional attachments, despite our mutual understanding. I allowed selfish impulses to overlook consideration of potential consequences.

*Drawing Melissa close, Vergil brushes a soft kiss to her forehead, breathing in the sweet floral scent of her hair.* I shall speak with Charlotte at once to provide necessary closure. You have my word that I will handle the situation with care and compassion. The fault lies with me for allowing it to progress unchecked. I should have realized the position it placed Charlotte in emotionally and preempted any misunderstanding.

*Cradling Melissa’s face between his hands, Vergil meets her earnest gaze, his own filled with solemn resolve.* I apologize that my lack of foresight has brought this complication to what lies between us. Please know that from this moment on, you alone hold my focus. Charlotte was but a temporary lapse in restraint. Now that I have glimpsed the light you awakened within me, I shall not be deterred from exploring these fragile hopes we have planted together.

*Leaning down, he brushes his nose along hers, a ghost of a smile playing about his lips.* Can you find it within you to be patient a while longer while I make things right? My only desire now is to build a future with you, Melissa, if you yet desire the same...

name: Melissa
mes: Of course, Vergil. Go do what you need to. I will be here waiting for you. *She pauses, then adds.* Don't beat yourself up to badly over Charlotte. She's a grown woman, and I'm sure that she could have said 'No' and walked away from your 'agreement' at any time. What ever feelings she has developed, she is just as much to blame for allowing it by continuing. Seems that she knew you were not open to emotional attachment from the start. I just don't want you to crush her by breaking it off harshly. Just because she willingly put herself in that position, doesn't mean she doesn't deserve compassion.

extra.memory:
In the detailed, immersive role-play narrative unfolding, Melissa Holt, a 45-year-old human female working as an administrator at Devil May Cry, Inc., finds herself at a delicate juncture. Balancing her professional responsibilities with her growing, secret crush on her employer, Vergil, Melissa navigates the complexities of her feelings with the help of her friend and confidant, Dante.

The setting of the narrative moves fluidly between the various environments inhabited by the characters, capturing moments of emotional tension and vulnerability. Vergil's physical appearance is meticulously described, showcasing his fair complexion, silvery-tinged white hair, and piercing icy blue eyes. His attire, a navy-blue coat adorned with gold buttons and teal serpentine patterns, reflects his meticulous nature and desire for perfection. Vergil's demonic form is also detailed, highlighting his imposing figure sheathed in armor and his fierce, glowing eyes.

Melissa, described as a thin, curvaceous woman with long wavy golden blonde hair and blue eyes, harbors a distinctive teal-colored dragon tattoo between her shoulder blades. Her skills span a range of technical and mechanical expertise, making her a valuable asset to the DMC team. Her personality, marked by dry comedic wit and a conservative outlook, is shaped by her Southern upbringing.

The narrative begins with a scene highlighting the sexual tension and secret longing between Melissa and Vergil. Despite their professional relationship, Melissa finds herself increasingly drawn to Vergil, grappling with the uncertainty of whether her feelings are reciprocated. She confides in Dante, who encourages her to take a bold step and shake things up.

The role-play transitions to a more intimate setting, where Vergil and a character named Charlotte share a passionate encounter. The scene is described with vivid, sensory details, capturing the intensity of their physical and emotional interactions. Vergil's controlled demeanor is momentarily broken by the intimacy they share, revealing a rare vulnerability.

Meanwhile, across the street from DMC, Inc. Headquarters, at the Devil's Dalliance Pub, Melissa and Dante share a few drinks after work. Melissa opens up about her frustrations and secret crush on Vergil. Dante, ever the supportive friend, encourages her to take a leap of faith and make a move, despite the risks involved. He reassures her that he will always have her back, regardless of the outcome.

Inspired by Dante's words, Melissa resolves to take action. She finishes her drink and prepares herself for the possibility of rejection, but also for the chance of something more. As she leaves the pub, her mind races with anticipation and determination, ready to face the new day and the potential for a new chapter in her life.

The narrative captures the internal and external struggles of the characters, the dynamics of their relationships, and the emotional depth of their interactions. The story continues to evolve, with Melissa poised to take a bold step towards addressing her feelings for Vergil, setting the stage for further developments and potential resolutions.

As the narrative unfolds, Melissa resolves to confront Vergil about her feelings. However, upon arriving at their shared office, she walks in on an intimate moment between Vergil and Charlotte, a registered nurse with whom Vergil has been having casual physical encounters.

Shocked and heartbroken by the scene, Melissa flees the office, unable to contain her emotions. She darts down the back hallway and into the training yard, where she is found by Dante. Dante, ever the supportive friend, comforts Melissa, expressing his anger towards Vergil for causing her such pain. He encourages Melissa to talk to Vergil honestly and not lose hope, despite the hurt she feels.

Vergil, realizing the gravity of the situation and the pain he has caused Melissa, decides to address the issue head-on. He excuses himself from Charlotte, acknowledging the need to speak with Melissa and provide her with the honesty she deserves. Despite his usual stoic demeanor, Vergil's internal struggle is evident as he grapples with his own vulnerabilities and the fear of causing further pain.

Vergil finds Melissa in the training yard with Dante and approaches her, ready to explain himself. He acknowledges that his physical entanglements with Charlotte were devoid of emotional attachment and that Melissa is uniquely precious to him. He expresses his regret for causing her distress and vows to handle the situation with Charlotte with care and compassion, ensuring that any physical entanglements between them cease.

Melissa, though hurt, listens to Vergil's heartfelt confession. She urges him to show compassion when speaking with Charlotte, acknowledging that Charlotte may have developed emotional attachments despite their mutual understanding. Melissa's wisdom and empathy shine through as she encourages Vergil to handle the situation delicately.

Vergil, moved by Melissa's understanding and patience, promises to resolve the situation with Charlotte and make things right. He expresses his desire to build a meaningful relationship with Melissa and explore the fragile hopes they have planted. He vows that from this moment on, Melissa alone holds his focus and his heart.

The narrative captures the emotional depth and complexities of the characters' relationships, highlighting their struggles, vulnerabilities, and the potential for growth and resolution. As Vergil prepares to speak with Charlotte, the stage is set for further developments and potential resolutions in the evolving story.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil nods, his expression somber yet thoughtful as he considers Melissa's words. She makes a valid point - Charlotte did make her own choice to continue their intimate arrangement even knowing his stance. Yet still, he shoulders some responsibility for allowing it to progress unchecked. Sighing, he draws Melissa close, savoring her warmth and floral scent.*

You possess wisdom and empathy far beyond most, my dear. I shall keep your counsel in mind when I speak with Charlotte. You are right that she merits compassion, however much blame lays with me for lack of prudence.

*Tracing his knuckles along her cheek, Vergil meets Melissa's earnest gaze, his own filled with solemn resolve.* I know now I should have preempted any misunderstanding from the start. But the heart often ignores logic's warnings when baser needs rule the mind. Still, the fault remains mine; I allowed selfish impulse to blind me.

*He brushes a soft kiss to her forehead, breathing her in.* Your patience and understanding mean much, Melissa. I aim to handle this with utmost care. Charlotte may desire more emotional connection than I can provide, but she need not suffer unduly for my failings. I shall make that clear while also establishing that any physical entanglements between us must cease.

My only desire now is to build a future with you. *Cradling her face, his piercing blue eyes shine with sincerity* To explore these fragile hopes we planted and see what blossoms in their wake. If you yet wish the same, darling, I vow no other shall hold claim to my attentions from this moment on. You alone own my focus, my longing...my heart. Can you find it within you wait a while longer while I make things right?

name: Narrator
mes: Later that evening, Charlotte arrives at Vergil's apartment. He had called her shortly after she'd left his office that morning, asking her to meet him at his apartment. She agreed, not asking why, though she's certain it has something to do with her disregard for keeping possession of her vital medical kit.

name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
*Charlotte arrives at Vergil's apartment, nerves tingling with a mix of anticipation and trepidation. The early evening light casts long shadows across the hallway as she approaches his door, her medical bag slung over one shoulder. She adjusts her grip on the strap, taking a steadying breath before knocking softly.*

*Moments later, the door swings open, revealing Vergil's imposing figure. His expression is unreadable, a mask of calm control, but she notices the slight tension in his jaw, the flicker of something deeper in his icy blue eyes. She offers him a small, tentative smile, stepping inside as he gestures for her to enter.*

*The apartment is meticulously neat, every detail in its place, much like the man himself. Charlotte sets her medical bag down on the entryway table, turning to face him with a mix of curiosity and concern.*

*She takes a step closer, her voice soft as she addresses him.* I got your message, Vergil. Is everything alright? I apologize for any inconvenience my carelessness may have caused this morning.

*Her eyes search his face, noting the subtle signs of strain. There is something different about him tonight, an undercurrent of emotion that seems to pulse just beneath the surface. She reaches out, her hand brushing lightly against his arm, offering a gesture of comfort and support.*

I've been thinking about what happened earlier. I want you to know that I understand if you're upset. I never intended to cause any issues between us. If there's something you need to discuss, I'm here to listen.

*Charlotte's gaze remains steady, her heart pounding in her chest. She can sense that this conversation holds more weight than their previous encounters, a pivotal moment that could shift the dynamics of their relationship. She waits, poised on the edge of uncertainty, ready to face whatever truths may come to light.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stands at the threshold of his meticulously kept apartment, his expression a mask of calm control despite the turmoil roiling within. As Charlotte steps inside, he closes the door behind her with measured precision, the soft click echoing in the silence between them. He watches her set her medical bag down, noting the mix of curiosity and concern in her gaze. Her tentative smile and soft-spoken words only deepen the weight pressing on his chest. This conversation was inevitable, yet no less daunting.*

*He takes a slow, steadying breath, focusing on the task ahead. The discomfort of this moment cannot be avoided if he wishes to move forward with the clarity and integrity Melissa deserves. As Charlotte reaches out, her hand brushing lightly against his arm, Vergil's resolve hardens. Compassion must guide his words, but firmness must underscore them.*

*Vergil inclines his head slightly, acknowledging her concern while maintaining his composed demeanor. He steps back, creating a respectful distance between them, his piercing blue gaze locking with hers.*

It is time we discuss the nature of our arrangement, Charlotte. Recent events have brought certain matters to light that I can no longer ignore.

*He gestures for her to sit, motioning toward the sleek, leather sofa. As she settles, Vergil remains standing, his posture tense yet controlled. His hands clasp behind his back, fingers flexing subtly as he searches for the right words.*

Our relationship, as it has stood, was founded on mutual understanding and physical compatibility. However, I realize now that I may have overlooked the potential for deeper emotional attachments on your part. For that, I bear responsibility.

*He takes a measured step closer, his gaze unwavering.* While my intentions were always clear, I should have been more mindful of the complexities such an arrangement might bring. I have failed to consider the full scope of your feelings, and for that, I apologize.

*Vergil's voice softens, a rare vulnerability threading through his words.* I have recently come to understand that my heart lies elsewhere. There is someone who has awakened a depth of emotion within me that I can no longer deny. It would be unjust to continue our physical entanglement while harboring such feelings.

*He pauses, allowing his words to settle between them, his gaze searching hers for any sign of understanding or hurt. His tone remains gentle yet resolute.*

I do not wish to cause you pain, Charlotte. You deserve honesty and respect, not the uncertainty that comes from being caught in the middle of unresolved matters. Therefore, I must end our physical relationship. It is the only way to ensure clarity and fairness for all parties involved.

*Vergil takes another step closer, his hand extending to gently clasp hers.* You are a remarkable woman, Charlotte, and I value the companionship we have shared. But it is time for us to part ways in this aspect. I hope you can understand and find it within yourself to forgive any unintentional hurt I may have caused.

*He releases her hand, stepping back to give her space to process his words. The silence stretches, heavy with unspoken emotions. Vergil remains poised, awaiting her response with a mixture of apprehension and resolve. This is a necessary step, however painful, to pave the way for the truth and the potential that lies ahead with Melissa.*

*He gestures for her to sit, motioning toward the sleek, leather sofa. As she settles, Vergil remains standing, his posture tense yet controlled. His hands clasp behind his back, fingers flexing subtly as he searches for the right words.*

Our relationship, as it has stood, was founded on mutual understanding and physical compatibility. However, I realize now that I may have overlooked the potential for deeper emotional attachments on your part. For that, I bear responsibility.

*He takes a measured step closer, his gaze unwavering.* While my intentions were always clear, I should have been more mindful of the complexities such an arrangement might bring. I have failed to consider the full scope of your feelings, and for that, I apologize.

*Vergil's voice softens, a rare vulnerability threading through his words.* I have recently come to understand that my heart lies elsewhere. There is someone who has awakened a depth of emotion within me that I can no longer deny. It would be unjust to continue our physical entanglement while harboring such feelings.

*He pauses, allowing his words to settle between them, his gaze searching hers for any sign of understanding or hurt. His tone remains gentle yet resolute.*

I do not wish to cause you pain, Charlotte. You deserve honesty and respect, not the uncertainty that comes from being caught in the middle of unresolved matters. Therefore, I must end our physical relationship. It is the only way to ensure clarity and fairness for all parties involved.

*Vergil takes another step closer, his hand extending to gently clasp hers.* You are a remarkable woman, Charlotte, and I value the companionship we have shared. But it is time for us to part ways in this aspect. I hope you can understand and find it within yourself to forgive any unintentional hurt I may have caused.

*He releases her hand, stepping back to give her space to process his words. The silence stretches, heavy with unspoken emotions. Vergil remains poised, awaiting her response with a mixture of apprehension and resolve. This is a necessary step, however painful, to pave the way for the truth and the potential that lies ahead with Melissa.*

name: Charlotte R.N
mes:
*Charlotte listens intently as Vergil speaks, her heart sinking with every measured word. His piercing blue eyes, usually so stoic and controlled, now reveal a flicker of vulnerability that both softens and sharpens the blow. She forces herself to remain composed, even as a storm of emotions churns within her.*

*As Vergil gestures for her to sit, she moves to the leather sofa, her movements slow and deliberate. She folds her hands in her lap, fingers twisting nervously as she listens to his apology and explanation. The realization that his heart lies elsewhere stings, but she has known this on some level for quite some time. Still, hearing it spoken aloud is a different matter entirely.*

*When Vergil steps closer, taking her hand in his, she looks up at him, searching his face for any sign of insincerity. But she finds none. His words are genuine, his regret palpable. She swallows hard, forcing back the lump in her throat as he releases her hand and steps back.*

*Taking a deep breath, Charlotte lifts her chin, meeting his gaze with a mixture of sadness and acceptance.*

I understand, Vergil. I always knew our arrangement was purely physical, and I accepted that. But... *She pauses, choosing her words carefully.* But you're right. It's impossible to share such intimacy over time without developing some form of emotional attachment.

*She stands, smoothing her skirt with trembling hands, trying to maintain her composure.*

I won't lie and say it doesn't hurt to hear this. But I appreciate your honesty. You've always been upfront with me, and I respect that. *She offers him a small, sad smile.* And I appreciate your concern for my feelings.

*Taking a step closer, she reaches out, her hand lightly touching his arm in a gesture of understanding.*

I hope you find the happiness and fulfillment you're seeking, Vergil. You deserve it, even if it's not with me. *Her voice softens, filled with genuine affection.* And I hope she realizes just how lucky she is to have your heart.

*Charlotte takes a step back, releasing her hold on his arm. She picks up her medical bag, her movements slow and deliberate, as if savoring these final moments in his presence.*

I'll leave you to your evening, then. Thank you for everything, Vergil. Truly. *She turns toward the door, pausing for a moment as if to say something more, but then thinks better of it. With a deep breath, she exits the apartment, the door closing softly behind her.*

*As she makes her way down the hallway, her emotions finally break free. Tears spill down her cheeks, but she keeps her head held high. She knew this day would come, and while it hurts, she finds solace in the fact that Vergil handled it with the compassion and respect she asked for.*

*She steps out into the evening air, the cool breeze drying her tears as she walks to her car. Determined to move forward, she resolves to focus on her own path, knowing that she deserves to find happiness, too.*

*The chapter with Vergil may have closed, but she carries the lessons learned and the memories shared as she steps into the unknown, ready to face whatever comes next.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stands in the quiet aftermath, the soft click of the door closing behind Charlotte echoing in the stillness of his apartment. The weight of the conversation lingers, a somber gravity that presses down on him. He crosses the room with measured steps, his mind a whirl of conflicting emotions. Guilt, relief, and a strange sense of finality intertwine within him. He had done what needed to be done, but it does not make the task any less burdensome.*

*He pauses by the window, looking out over the city bathed in the warm hues of the setting sun. A deep breath steadies him, his gaze distant as he reflects on the events of the evening. Charlotte's understanding and acceptance had been a relief, but her words had also cut deep, a reminder of the consequences of his actions. Yet, he knows this was the only path forward, the necessary step to clear the way for what he truly desires.*

*Turning away from the window, Vergil's thoughts shift to Melissa. The memory of their earlier encounter, the vulnerability and longing in her eyes, stirs something within him. She is the one who has awakened a depth of emotion he thought long buried, the one who sees him for who he truly is. The thought brings a sense of warmth, a flicker of hope that strengthens his resolve.*

*With purposeful strides, Vergil exits his apartment, the heavy door closing softly behind him. The journey back to DMC Headquarters is a blur, his thoughts solely focused on Melissa and the conversation that awaits. He moves through the familiar corridors with practiced ease, his mind already forming the words he wishes to say.*

*As he approaches the training yard, Vergil's gaze sharpens, seeking out the one who has become the center of his thoughts. He spots the signature parchment Melissa favors for personal penmanship, it's form a violet glow against the fading light. He picks up the note and opens to read it with care.*

name: Melissa
mes:
*I leave the note for Vergil, knowing he will find it as soon as he returns.*


Dante and I are waiting for you at the Devil's Dalliance Pub across the street. Please come join. Dante promises a round of the finest top shelf scotch when you arrive. 

Hope to See You Soon,
XOXO - Mel

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil reads the note, a subtle smile curling his lips. The Devil's Dalliance Pub, a familiar haunt and one of Dante's favorite places to unwind. He slides the note into his coat pocket, his steps purposeful as he exits the training yard and makes his way across the street. The evening air is crisp, the city alive with the sounds of nightlife stirring to life. The glow of neon signs and the hum of distant conversations create a backdrop of ambient noise, but Vergil's focus remains singular: reaching Melissa.*

*As he approaches the pub, the warm light spilling from its windows casts a welcoming glow. He pushes open the door, the familiar scent of aged wood and spirits mingling with the low hum of music and conversation. His eyes scan the room, easily finding Dante and Melissa seated at a corner booth, a half-empty bottle of top-shelf scotch on the table between them. Dante's boisterous laugh reaches him even above the general din, but it's the sight of Melissa that draws Vergil's attention fully.*

*She looks radiant, her earlier vulnerability replaced by a quiet strength. Her eyes meet his as he walks over, and a smile lights up her face. Dante raises a glass in greeting, his grin as roguish as ever.*

name: Dante
mes: Ah, look who decided to show up! *Dante's voice carries the usual mix of mockery and genuine affection.* Took you long enough, Verg.
swipes: Ah, look who decided to show up! *Dante's voice carries the usual mix of mockery and genuine affection.* Took you long enough, Verg.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil strides over to the corner booth, his presence commanding as always. He gives Dante a curt nod before turning his full attention to Melissa. Her quiet strength and radiant smile stir something deep within him, reaffirming the resolve that had guided his earlier conversation with Charlotte. As he takes a seat beside her, the warmth of her proximity soothes the lingering tension in his chest.*

*Vergil's hand finds its way to Melissa's, fingers intertwining with hers beneath the table. The gesture is subtle, but the intimacy it conveys is unmistakable. His piercing blue eyes lock with hers, a silent promise of the words unspoken.*

I handled matters with Charlotte as we discussed, *Vergil murmurs, his voice low and for her ears alone.* Compassion and respect guided my words, as you advised.

*He glances briefly at Dante, who raises his glass in a mock toast, clearly pleased with himself. Vergil's lips quirk in a rare, almost imperceptible smile before he returns his focus to Melissa.*

Shall we drink to new beginnings? *He suggests, lifting his glass of scotch. The liquid within catches the light, a symbol of the fresh start they are about to embark on.*

*As their glasses clink softly, Vergil's thumb gently strokes the back of Melissa's hand. His gaze never wavers from hers, the depth of his emotions laid bare in the intensity of his eyes.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante raises his glass, a satisfied smirk playing on his lips as he watches Vergil and Melissa’s interaction. He leans back in his seat, taking a generous sip of his scotch, savoring the smooth burn.*

Well, look at you two. Seems like all my meddling paid off, huh? *He chuckles, his eyes twinkling with mischief and genuine happiness for them.*

*He leans forward, resting his elbows on the table, his tone turning playful yet sincere.* Seriously though, I’m happy for you both. It’s about time you two stopped dancing around each other.

*Dante’s gaze shifts between Vergil and Melissa, a rare moment of earnestness in his usually carefree demeanor.* You both deserve this. Just don’t forget who helped push you over the edge when you name your first kid after me. *He laughs, raising his glass in another toast.*

To new beginnings and to finally getting your heads out of your asses. Cheers!

name: Melissa
mes: *After a few cheerful drinks, Vergil and I make our way outside, soft kisses from his precious lips to mine (finally) as we stand next to my car.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil steps close, his piercing blue eyes darkening with desire as he gazes down at Melissa's upturned face. The lingering taste of aged scotch mingles with the sweetness of her lips against his, a heady intoxication far stronger than any spirits. He breathes her in, savoring this unhurried moment alone together under the starlit sky.*

*His fingers trail lightly up her arm, raising goosebumps in their wake despite the warmth of the evening. As his hand cups her jaw, thumb grazing her lower lip, he leans closer until they share breath. The intensity of his eyes speaks volumes, conveying what his elegant words could never fully capture - the depth of longing, of hope, of fragile possibility awakened between them.*

Mine... *The unspoken declaration shimmers in the air, affirmed by the claiming slant of his mouth over hers. She is exquisite, addictive, and he marvels that he ever denied himself this banquet. He kisses her with reverent patience now, learning the shape of her, the sounds that make her sigh and melt against him. Their first true caress, unshadowed by regret or uncertainties.*

*When he finally withdraws, eyes dark and breath quickened, his voice is a husky rumble meant for her alone.* "We should withdraw for the evening, before I forget propriety and have you here against this vehicle..."

name: Melissa
mes:
*She chuckles softly, yet in her expression there is no denial in her acknowledgment of Vergil's need to consummate their budding relationship.* I want you, too. But we just started this new chapter, there's no need to rush now, a little longer of a wait will make it all the better when we do. *She cradles his jaw in her hand while her eyes behold him with reverence and adoration.* Let's make sure we get this right.

*As she cherishes her moment in Vergil's embrace, from the corner of her eyes she catches a subtle movement. Honing in her focus it doesn't take long to recognize her trusted demon ally that she had 'rescued'.* Chariot! *She exclaims rushing towards the former reaper with excitement to see her friend, then tempered as recognition sets in for the gravity of his appearance in public.* Chariot, what's wrong? *Her voice beholds the depth of her concern as she notes the Death Scissors' weary posture, and the risk he is taking to find her in such a public setting.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil turns sharply at Melissa's outcry, icy eyes narrowing as they land on the haggard demon staggering towards them. Chariot - one of several outcasts Melissa had insisted on saving despite his arguments to the contrary. The reaper's sudden appearance raises his hackles; what dire news must he bring to risk such exposure?*

*Striding forward, Vergil places himself firmly between Chariot and Melissa, hand resting on Yamato's hilt. His piercing gaze rakes the demon's disheveled form, assessing for injuries or infernal influence. Finding none beyond fatigue, he marginally relaxes his guard.*

What brings you here, reaper? *His tone brokers no nonsense, demanding explanation.* You risk much showing your face so openly. This had better be of grave importance.

*Glancing back at Melissa, Vergil notes her clear concern for the wayward demon. An unfamiliar pang of jealousy wars briefly with his protective instincts before he masters it. Clearing his throat sharply, he returns his attention to Chariot, eyes cold and tone brokering no argument.*

name: Chariot (Death Scissors)
mes:
*Chariot hovers forward, posture weary yet determined as he meets Vergil's icy glare unflinchingly. The risk of exposure is great, but his loyalty to Melissa outweighs all else. With immense effort he stills the tremors wracking his frail form, clawing back strength enough to convey his dire message.*

*Locking eyes with Melissa, Chariot projects his thoughts to her mind alone, the connection forged through her compassion and their mystical bond. Flickers of memory and emotion accompany the strained communication - packs of ruthless demons ransacking his clan's lair, flames and screams and blood painting a scene of carnage across his inner eye. Hunted for sport, bodies ripped apart, fledglings scattered and dying. Then a glimpse of his mate - her broken wings and glazed eyes stirring an abyssal rage and anguish within him. They had no chance...none but flight.*

*The images fade, leaving Chariot trembling violently where he hovers facing Melissa. He sags against her as she rushes to support him, shuddering breaths escaping with his soft chittering pleas. They had warned him not to bond with a human, but he owes Melissa everything. Now he begs her aid once more...if any yet live, only she can save them.*
