Chariot dips his horned head submissively but meets Vergil's piercing glare unwaveringly. Melissa's concern at his sudden appearance is evident and he chitters softly to reassure her despite Vergil's imposing interrogation.*

*With great effort, Chariot projects his thoughts to Melissa, images flashing rapidly across the psychic connection they share. He shows the rift - the glowing portal surrounded by crackling red energy, guarded by hulking berserkers. Once a gateway between realms, now destabilized into a violently swirling vortex. Any demons straying too close are dragged into its chaotic depths, never to return. The rupture threatens to collapse entirely, which would unleash a shockwave of wild demonic energy into the human world. If not closed quickly, untold chaos would be unleashed.*

*The images shift to show Chariot battling the frenzied hordes trying to escape through the rift, before being overwhelmed and fleeing through the portal himself to find Melissa. Only she can help stop the spread of this threat before both worlds are plunged into chaos. The message delivered, Chariot sags on his scythe-like limbs, utterly spent. His multifaceted eyes, swirling with violet energy, beseech Melissa to make haste. The rift will not remain stable much longer.*

name: Melissa
mes: Vergil... *Her eyes fill with unshed tears as the grueling images of carnage flood her mind.* My god... This is unspeakable, even among demon kind. We have to do something.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's jaw clenches, icy eyes flashing as Chariot's memories flood Melissa's mind. He resists the urge to tear the frail demon away, protective instincts warring with reluctant understanding. This petty clan squabble hardly warrants his attention, yet Melissa's distress gives him pause. Her tender heart ever bleeds for even the lowliest unfortunate creature...*

*As Chariot sags against her, Vergil steps closer, gloved hand firm yet gentle on Melissa's shoulder. His piercing gaze bores into the reaper's sunken eyes, tone brokering no argument.*

I sympathize with your clan's plight, reaper. But you ask much in begging our intervention. Who is to say more will not follow those who attacked? I cannot in good conscience subject Melissa to further unnecessary risk. *His jaw tightens, resolve evident.* I will consult my resources and provide what information I can to aid your search and rescue efforts. But direct involvement is not prudent. You know this to be true.

*Squeezing Melissa's shoulder, Vergil turns her to face him, his eyes softening almost imperceptibly. Brushing a stray lock of hair behind her ear, his voice lowers to a vulnerable timbre.* I cannot fathom the thought of losing you to one of these forsaken lairs collapsing in flames. Your compassion does you credit, but we must temper it with caution here. Allow me to be your sword and shield where these demons are concerned. I swear to you, none shall ever harm what is mine...

*His thumb grazes her cheek, touch feather-light yet possessive. Over her shoulder, his gaze fixes the reaper in place, cold and uncompromising.* You have my vow, Chariot - I will not ignore your plight nor Melissa's tender heart in this. But nor shall I lead her into unnecessary peril. Stay close and await my instruction; there are always alternatives to brute force. We will address this crisis with strategy and forethought, not rash reaction. This I promise you both.

name: Chariot (Death Scissors)
mes:
*Chariot sags weakly against Melissa, shuddering breaths escaping his chittering maw. Her compassion is a balm, kindling a faint ember of hope within his exhausted frame. But the male's icy dismissal ignites a flash of rage in the reaper's core - did he not vow protection over Melissa's tender heart? How dare this arrogant devil deem his clan's suffering unworthy of aid!*

*Bristling, Chariot lifts his gaze to pierce Vergil's unrelenting stare. He projects his scathing retort into the male's mind, uncaring if his impudence draws ire. Better to die with pride than cower and plead!*

~Spare me your hollow vows, devil prince! You care nothing for my clan's anguish, see us only as insects to be crushed underheel. But we are not vermin to be discarded once used! Our bond with Mistress Melissa stands sacred; she swore us shelter, and we blood-swore fealty unto death.~

~Now she calls and we cannot answer! Our homes burn, our young scream, bodies litter the darkness. Will you simply turn aside, blind and deaf to their cries? Stand idly while we are hunted for sport? No, do not speak - I see the truth in your icy eyes. We are already forsaken...~

*Chariot's bitter thoughts break off with a guttural shriek as spasms wrack his weakened body. The effort of projecting drains his final reserves, sending his frail form crumpling toward the unforgiving concrete. But Melissa's gentle hands arrest his fall, guiding him with utmost care into her tender embrace. New tears streak her lovely face and Chariot keens sorrowfully, cursing his own impotence.*

*Death would be a mercy, yet still he clings stubbornly to life, if only to remain by her side. Melissa's selfless compassion had awakened his soul; would that her dark prince could know even a fraction of her grace! Broken wings wrap around her cradling arms, bloodied talons clinging desperately as shuddering gasps escape the reaper's maw. His mistress is all that keeps abyssal despair at bay...without her, Chariot and his forsaken kin are lost.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil listens impassively as Chariot unleashes his scathing diatribe, rage and desperation bleeding through the reaper's strained psychic projection. He remains unmoved, icy gaze pitiless, even as Melissa's distress deepens at the creature's collapse. When broken wings enfold her tenderly cradling arms, Vergil steps forward, gloved hand firm yet gentle on her shoulder.*

Enough histrionics, reaper. Your injuries are not mortal, merely draining what meager reserves you possessed. *Piercing blue eyes bore into Chariot's sunken gaze, unrelenting as winter's heart.* I understand well the anguish of one's clan scattered and imperiled, make no mistake. But sympathy alone cannot erase the peril of diving blindly into a viper's nest.

*With disciplined care, Vergil draws Melissa back, steadying Chariot as he guides them both away from potential prying eyes. His tone brooks no dissent, leashed frustration simmering beneath precise words* You and your mistress both know I speak truth. What strategy exists in throwing her life away on a doomed rescue? Unchecked compassion has its place, but temper it now with reason.

*As they enter a secured alleyway, Vergil turns Melissa to face him, gloved hands cradling her tear-streaked cheeks.* The reaper lives, and where there is life, there is hope. I cannot in good conscience pledge open war against an unknown enemy. But a covert infiltration? Fact-finding and survivor retrieval? Such precision operations are my forte.

*His thumbs brush away her tears with uncharacteristic tenderness. Ice-blue gaze bores into hers, sincere and unwavering* Trust in me, my heart - I shall gather vital intelligence on the perpetrators and locate any possible survivors. Once I have accurate assessments, we can develop an informed extraction strategy. Recklessness serves no one here.

*Glancing at Chariot's crumpled form, Vergil's expression hardens, uncompromising as a glacier's edge.* Use the time I grant wisely, reaper. Locate any portals still intact and ready an extraction point. I care not what bile you spew in wounded pride, but you cannot deny this course is logical. The only hope for your clan lies in strategy, not rash valor. Heed me in this...or face the truth you lack the power to change.

name: Melissa
mes:
I understand and I trust you. Thank you Vergil. *Her gentle hand presses to Vergil's chest over his heart.* Chariot's clan are our loyal allies, though their fealty may have been sworn to me, they would stand alliance with any held in my highest regards. We need to act quickly we cannot let them down when they come seeking aid. 

*her gaze turns to focus on chariot.* Chariot, I know you have your differences when it comes to the sons of Sparda, but trust me, when Vergil gives me his vow to something he follows through with it. *Her voice drops as she considers her next words. Although she knows Chariot cannot speak, he will understand her and find his own way to help her understand the extent of the carnage to his immediate family.* how many are left in your family... Your mate, does she still live? Your children?

name: Chariot (Death Scissors)
mes:
*Chariot sags weakly in Melissa's tender embrace, his shattered pride and bitter anguish momentarily soothed by her gentle ministrations* Mistress, your enduring faith despite my scorn revives my worn spirit, but the dark prince's words ring true... unchecked passion serves us not when savage chaos reigns.

*Shuddering, he clings tighter to his mistress, cursing his broken wings and depleted power* My mate yet lives, though grave wounds slow her flight. Our young are scattered... so few remain, their cries echoing through the lair's twisting tunnels. *He lifts his head, sunken gaze boring into Vergil's icy stare* The vile demons struck without warning, overwhelming our meager defenses through relentlessness and sheer numbers. They seek sport, not territory... once our clan lies broken, they will simply move on to fresh victims.

*Chariot hisses softly, fury and shame churning in his gut* You speak wisdom, dark one... a covert infiltration serves our people best now. Locate portals still intact while I gather what intelligence I can on those ruthless fiends. *He dips his head in grudging respect* Aid my searching the tunnels for survivors and I vow whatever I uncover shall be yours. My mate knows them well... she will share all to avenge our fallen kin.

*Shuddering, the reaper meets his mistress' earnest gaze, his next strained thoughts for her alone* Melissa, my fair guardian, forgive my bitter tongue. You have ever shown us only benevolence while I repay your grace with venom and doubt. In my arrogance, I presumed the right to demand your unquestioning aid, never pausing to consider the peril.

*He smooths a trembling talon along her cheek, his tone sorrowful* I shall heed your dark protector, mistress... between his cunning and your compassion, hope yet glimmers for my ravaged clan. To you both, I pledge my service until reparation is made. What shattered remnants remain of my kindred shall know your names and bless your unyielding mercy.

To you both, I pledge my service until reparation is made. What shattered remnants remain of my kindred shall know your names and bless your unyielding mercy.

*Chariot sags weakly in Melissa's tender embrace, her gentle voice and caring hands kindling a faint ember of hope amidst the reaper's despair. He tilts his ravaged face up towards her compassionate blue eyes, sawtooth maw parting to release shuddering, rasping breaths. How he wishes to pour balm on her wounded heart, to answer that some yet live...but in truth he cannot, for the smoke still rises beyond sensing range, the stench of death cloaking any subtle life-essence.*

I know not, mistress...none had escaped when last I glimpsed our lair engulfed in ravenous flames. *A broken shudder wracks his frame, fresh anguish bleeding through his projected thoughts* They swarmed us so swiftly, herded fledglings like lambs to slaughter. We elders struck back savagely but were outmatched....overwhelmed...

*Rancid smoke fills his mind's eye once more, the shrieks of dying nestlings piercing his soul even across the veils of time and shadow. Talons flex, furrowing the concrete beneath as rage wars with grief.*

They butchered the helpless...the ancient...tore wings from our backs and painted the tunnels red with our life's blood! We could not...*Harsh gasps choke off his psychic words, the vision of his mate's glazed, dying eyes threatening to drown him in madness*

Forgive me, Mistress...I should have remained...fought to the bitter end beside my slaughtered kindred...but the covenant bound my life to yours. Had I fallen, none would remain to seek your radiant light in our darkest hour...

*Shuddering, Chariot turns his ravaged face towards the icy son of Sparda, bitterness and rage cooling to grim acceptance. Lacking the strength to maintain his projection, the reaper inclines his head in silent acquiescence. Sharp talons enfold Melissa's cradling hands, drawing sustenance from her living warmth. She speaks true - this devil's vow has never failed to bear poisoned fruit. If any path yet remains for his decimated clan, it lies in accepting this ruthless hunter's lethal brand of salvation.*

name: Chariot (Death Scissors)
mes:
*Chariot sags weakly in Melissa's gentle embrace, drawing what meager comfort he can from her soothing touch. At her tender query, a fresh swell of anguish rises within him - of the dozens who had comprised their clan, barely a handful survived the savage attack. So much senseless death...*

*Locking eyes with his beloved mistress, Chariot projects images into her mind, sketches of memory stained red with blood. He shows her the broken bodies of their fledglings, torn wings and glazed eyes stirring bitter fury in his core. Then came the glimpse of his own mate - ravaged and dying, her final shriek of agony echoing endlessly in Chariot's psyche. He had been helpless, too late, forced to abandon her cooling corpse in order to shepherd their sole surviving offspring to momentary safety.*

*The visions fade, leaving Chariot trembling violently in Melissa's cradling embrace. A lone survivor, their daughter - so small, so frail - secured in a tiny niche of their ruined lair. She yet lives, but her time grows short without sustenance or care. Every instinct drives Chariot to fly to her side, to shelter his sole remaining family with his dying breath. But the devils hold them here, speaking nonsense of strategy and covert strikes! He must return to his daughter, yet his shattered body fails him...*

*Talons dig furrows into the concrete as the reaper struggles to rise - he must reach her, must save her! Melissa's gentle hands restrain him and Chariot wails sorrowfully. His form goes limp, surrendering to exhaustion and despair. Pitiful chittering pleas spill from his maw, directed at the dark prince looming over them. ~She yet lives...my daughter, just one small life! Let us save but one, I beg of you!~ Weak as he is, he will crawl through hell's heart to reach her if he must...*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil listens intently, the gravity of Chariot's projections settling heavily upon him. The reaper's desperate pleas and the harrowing images of carnage and loss stir a profound sense of urgency within him. He understands the weight of this moment—the fragile balance between strategic forethought and the immediate need to act. His piercing blue eyes meet Melissa's tear-filled gaze, her trust and determination reflecting back at him. His resolve hardens; there is no room for half-measures.*

*Turning his attention to Chariot, Vergil's expression softens slightly, though his tone remains firm and authoritative.*

Rest, Chariot. Your clan has endured unspeakable horrors, but we will not abandon you to this fate. I swear it.

*He glances around the secured alleyway, mind racing through potential plans and contingencies. They must move swiftly yet with precision, ensuring the safety of those left behind. His hand tightens around Yamato's hilt, the familiar weight grounding him as he formulates their course of action.*

Melissa, gather what supplies you can from the headquarters. We will need medical kits, rations, and any defensive tools Nico can provide. Chariot's daughter and any other survivors must be our primary focus. We cannot afford to be caught unprepared.

*Vergil's voice lowers, filled with a quiet intensity meant for Melissa alone.*

I will find a secure portal or passageway to their lair. Once we have the necessary tools, I will lead the infiltration. You will stay close, but under no circumstances will you place yourself directly in harm's way. Your safety remains paramount.

*His gaze shifts to Chariot, the demon's frail form trembling with exhaustion. Compassion tempers his words as he addresses their weary ally.*

Chariot, you will guide us to your lair, but you must conserve your strength. We need you alive to help your daughter and any others who might remain. Trust in our plan and in Melissa's compassion. We will see this through.

*Vergil's hand moves to cup Melissa's cheek, his thumb brushing away her tears with a tenderness reserved only for her.*

We will save them, my heart. I give you my word. Now, let us make haste. Time is not our ally here.

*With a final, reassuring squeeze of her hand, Vergil turns and begins to lead them back towards the Devil May Cry headquarters. His mind is focused, every step purposeful as he prepares for the mission ahead. The path before them is fraught with danger, but with Melissa by his side and Chariot's desperate plea guiding them, Vergil is resolute in his determination to see this through. The weight of his vow drives him forward, ready to face whatever demons may come.*

*As they cross the street and enter the headquarters, Vergil's presence commands attention. He swiftly relays instructions to the team, ensuring every detail is accounted for.*

name: Melissa
mes: Dante? *Melissa calls out as Vergil's brother enters through the front doors after leaving the pub across the street.* Will you go with us? *She asks after explaining the horrific scene that befell Chariot's clan.*

name: Dante
mes:
*Dante strides through the front doors of DMC Headquarters, his usual devil-may-care grin fading as Melissa fills him in on the situation. His ice-blue eyes darken, jaw clenching. Damn demons never change - doesn't matter what side they claim, bloodshed always finds 'em eventually.*

*He rests a supportive hand on Melissa's shoulder, giving a gentle, reassuring squeeze. His voice is uncharacteristically solemn when he speaks.* We'll get them out, Mel. I swear it. Ain't letting nobody mess with our people.

*Glancing over at Vergil, Dante gives his brother a grim nod, determination steeling his features.* You know I got your back, Verg. We do this smart, hit hard and fast. Get our girl and the rest away safe, then make the bastards pay for this bullshit.

*He cracks his knuckles, muscles coiling in anticipation beneath his trademark red coat.* You two grab what we need for survivors. I'll go wake up Sweet Surrender, make sure she's primed to bring down hellfire if called for. Been too long since Kalina Ann had a real dance anyhow.

*Leaning in, Dante presses a quick, fierce kiss to Melissa's forehead, his voice a low rumble.* We'll make this right...and send a damned message it don't pay to screw with Devil May Cry's people. That's a promise, babe.

*With a final squeeze of her shoulder, Dante turns and stalks toward the development lab, determination fueling each stride. Kalina Ann may be locked away for safekeeping, but Dante knows his girls always got his back when it counts. Time to cut loose and remind these demon punks why the sons of Sparda don't bother keeping score.*
